html: 9.21.17  3:47 pm   I really struggle with communicating with others in a work environment, and I don't know how to make small talk so I can appear 'normal' and not stand out as super quiet. I know that I'll be working with other people for the rest of my life in my chosen career path, and I find it impossible to make friends (my only friend was someone I met on a film forum ten years ago) so essentially, how do I navigate this? I hate drawing negative attention to myself but I feel I do that by being so quiet whenever I'm at work, even though I usually have nothing to contribute. It's often presumed something's wrong with me because I remain silent, but I feel absolutely fine most of the time and I'll be polite/reply when spoken to. I only really connect with someone if they have the same level of social ineptitude or have the same very specific and intense interests as me. Please, help a gal out. Thanks.

9.20.17  10:34 pm   Ya know how music is all like, "Hey bud, you can write me, but you better write me bad a lot until you write me good," and then you're like, "no, i wanna write you good right now," and music say, "nah, bud, it's gotta be bad. Later it can be good, but be bad right now," and you say, " fine, whatever," and then you make music and it is always bad and then you are like, "when will it get good," and then music is all like, "it doesn't. It is always bad, and that's really good," and then you're like, "that makes no fucking sense what are you talking about," and music says, "well, I was just thinking that maybe I could, like, inspire you by saying that music is bad and you've been making bad music so I'm just trying to show that, like, if you make the music bad it is good or something," and then there's a long pause and then you're like, "I'm gonna make good music now," and music says, "fine whatever." Does that happen to you?

9.20.17  9:30 pm   some time ago i realized how Uncomfortable fixed labels were, and i decided i disliked labels entirely and should avoid them completely. it didn't really work, i found myself being attracted to labels sometimes, but then, in the same situations, sometimes getting really uncomfortable with them. which was confusing, but now i think I've figured it out: i like labels, but only when i can play with and mess around with them however i want. is this something you can relate to?

9.20.17  8:29 pm   I'm blown away when I see a band playing a really long song with lots of changes and intricate melodies/harmonies and rhythm hits and stuff, but they're playing it without looking at any sheet music. Or Ill see somebody playing the entire "rite of spring" or something on piano without any music in front of them. Do you think being able to memorize long and intracite, detailed pieces of music is a skill that you can improve upon over time? Like can you sharpen your "musical memory" or whatever you want to call it? Does it just start to automatically  become easier to do the longer you've been playing?
